Potential Cause: Disk partition may not have enough storage space per the requirements specified in ``input/provision_config`` (under ``disk_partition``).
Resolution: Add more space to the server or modify the requirements specified in ``input/provision_config`` (under ``disk_partition``).

Potential Cause: The provided ISO may be corrupt/incomplete.
Resolution: Download the ISO again, verify the checksum/ download size and re-run the provision tool.

Potential Cause: Hardware issues (Auto reboot may fail at POST)
Resolution: Resolve/replace the faulty hardware and PXE boot the node.

Potential Cause: A virtual disk may not have been created
Resolution: Create a virtual disk and PXE boot the node.

Potential Cause: Re-run of the discovery_provision.yml playbook on the control plane while provisioning is in-progress on the remote nodes.
Resolution: Initiate PXE boot on the remote node after completion of the discovery_provision.yml playbook execution.

Potential Cause: nfs-server may not be running. This failure can occur due to low memory.
Resolution: Increase memory if its low and restart the nfs-server service using the ``systemctl start nfs-server`` command and then PXE boot the node.
